results.title: Molly
results.creator_credit: John Molloy, Liz Doran, M4 Entertainment Production and Mushroom Pictures
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings in Quambatook, Ian Meldrum rose to become the most influential and well known name in Australian music.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

results.title: Modern Times
results.brief_description: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

constellations_other.name: Cinema to superheroes
constellations_other.description: This Magnaphonic Projector and its double were originally used in the Tallangatta cinema in the 1930s.

results.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
results.creator_credit: Paramount, Bad Robot, Skydance Media, TC Productions, Alibaba Pictures Group, Christopher McQuarrie, Bruce Geller, Tom Cruise, J.J. Abrams, Peter Wenham, Dana Goldberg, Jake Myers, Bryan Burk, Don Granger, David Ellison and Raphaël Benoliel
results.headline_credit: China, France, Norway and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: When an IMF mission ends badly, the world is faced with dire consequences. As Ethan Hunt takes it upon himself to fulfill his original briefing, the CIA begin to question his loyalty and his motives. The IMF team find themselves in a race against time, hunted by assassins while trying to prevent a global catastrophe.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

results.title: Mission: Impossible
results.creator_credit: Barry Crane, Robert H. Justman, Allan Balter, William Woodfield, Joseph Gantman, Desilu Productions and Paramount Television
results.brief_description: Mission: Impossible is an American television series that was created and initially produced by Bruce Geller. It chronicles the missions of a team of secret government agents known as the Impossible Missions Force.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Crane, Robert H. Justman, Allan Balter, William Woodfield, Joseph Gantman, Desilu Productions and Paramount Television
results.description:
Mission: Impossible is an American television series that was created and initially produced by Bruce Geller. It chronicles the missions of a team of secret government agents known as the Impossible Missions Force. In the first season, the team is led by Dan Briggs, played by Steven Hill; Jim Phelps, played by Peter Graves, takes charge for the remaining seasons. A hallmark of the series shows Briggs or Phelps receiving his instructions on a recording that then self-destructs, followed by the theme music composed by Lalo Schifrin.

The series aired on the CBS network from September 1966 to March 1973, then returned to television for two seasons on ABC, from 1988 to 1990, retaining only Graves in the cast. It later inspired a popular series of theatrical motion pictures starring Tom Cruise, beginning in 1996.
description_for_label:
Mission: Impossible is an American television series that was created and initially produced by Bruce Geller. It chronicles the missions of a team of secret government agents known as the Impossible Missions Force. In the first season, the team is led by Dan Briggs, played by Steven Hill; Jim Phelps, played by Peter Graves, takes charge for the remaining seasons. A hallmark of the series shows Briggs or Phelps receiving his instructions on a recording that then self-destructs, followed by the theme music composed by Lalo Schifrin.

The series aired on the CBS network from September 1966 to March 1973, then returned to television for two seasons on ABC, from 1988 to 1990, retaining only Graves in the cast. It later inspired a popular series of theatrical motion pictures starring Tom Cruise, beginning in 1996.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries
results.brief_description: Our lady sleuth sashays through the back lanes and jazz clubs of late-1920s Melbourne, fighting injustice with her pearl handled pistol and dagger sharp wit. Leaving a trail of admirers in her wake, our thoroughly modern heroine makes sure she enjoys every moment of her lucky life.

constellations_other.name: Monsters, murder and mystery
constellations_other.description: Murder and mystery hide in the shadows born from German Expressionism.

results.description: Our lady sleuth sashays through the back lanes and jazz clubs of late 1920s Melbourne, fighting injustice with her pearl handled pistol and her dagger sharp wit. Leaving a trail of admirers in her wake, our thoroughly modern heroine makes sure she enjoys every moment of her lucky life. Based on author Kerry Greenwood’s Phryne Fisher Murder Mystery novels.

Leaving a trail of admirers in her wake, our thoroughly modern heroine makes sure she enjoys every moment of her lucky life. Based on author Kerry Greenwood’s Phryne Fisher Murder Mystery novels.

results.title: Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
results.creator_credit: Lucasfilm Ltd., American Zoetrope, Tristone Entertainment Inc., M Company, Tom Luddy, Paul Schrader, Leonard Schrader, Catherine Craig, Mataichirô Yamamoto, Eiko Ishioka and Etsuko Yagyu
results.headline_credit: Japan and United States of America, 1985
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the life of Japanese author Yukio Mishima told in four parts. The first three parts relate events in three of his novels: The Temple of the Golden Pavilion, Kyoko’s House, and Runaway Horses. The last part depicts the events of 25th November 1970.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lucasfilm Ltd., American Zoetrope, Tristone Entertainment Inc., M Company, Tom Luddy, Paul Schrader, Leonard Schrader, Catherine Craig, Mataichirô Yamamoto, Eiko Ishioka and Etsuko Yagyu
results.description: A fictional account of the life of Japanese author Yukio Mishima told in four parts. The first three parts relate events in three of his novels: The Temple of the Golden Pavilion, Kyoko’s House, and Runaway Horses. The last part depicts the events of 25th November 1970.

results.title: Miranda
results.brief_description: A young married physician discovers a mermaid, and gives into her request to be taken to see London. Comedy and romantic entanglements ensue soon after.

constellations_other.name: Ice Queens and Sirens of the sea
constellations_other.description: Sports stars and mythological creatures on-screen.

results.title: Minority Report
results.brief_description: John Anderton is a top ‘Precrime’ cop in the late-21st century, when technology can predict crimes before they’re committed. But Anderton becomes the quarry when another investigator targets him for a murder charge.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

results.title: Minding the Gap
results.creator_credit: Independent Television Service (ITVS), Kartemquin Films, P.O.V./American Documentary and Bing Liu
results.brief_description: Three young men bond together to escape volatile families in their Rust Belt hometown. As they face adult responsibilities, unexpected revelations threaten their decade-long friendship.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

results.title: Mindhunter
results.creator_credit: Jim Davidson, Steve Arnold, Jennifer Starzyk, Liz Hannah, Panic Pictures / No. 13, Denver and Delilah Productions and Jen X Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: An agent in the FBI’s Elite Serial Crime Unit develops profiling techniques as he pursues notorious serial killers and rapists.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.
